name: N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2787
Reason: The compound N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that affect its melting point. The basic structure of the compound is a benzene ring with two phenyl groups attached, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The thiopyran ring adds a significant increase in melting point due to the presence of sulfur, which can form strong intermolecular bonds with other molecules. The diphenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to the increased conjugation and potential for pi-pi interactions. The amine group can form hydrogen bonds, which tend to increase the melting point. The presence of two methyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to participate in van der Waals interactions.
